definitions.definition: make (something) ready for use or consideration.
examples: prepare a brief summary of the article
synonyms: formulate "I want you to prepare a report"

examples: the spokesman was reading a prepared statement

definitions.definition: make (food or a meal) ready for cooking or eating.
synonyms: rustle up "the meal was easy to prepare"

definitions.definition: make (someone) ready or able to do or deal with something.
examples: schools should prepare children for life
synonyms: get everything set More"preparing for war"train
get ready "athletes preparing for the Olympics"study
review "I must prepare for my exams"instruct
prime "this course prepares students for their exams"brace
in position "he needs to be prepared for the worst"

examples: I wasn't prepared to go along with that
synonyms: minded "I'm not prepared to cut the price"

definitions.definition: make (a chemical product) by a reaction or series of reactions.
(in conventional harmony) lead up to (a discord) by means of preparation.
